intro: Antigramma cardiophylla, commonly known as the heart-leaf antigramma, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its glossy, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded, moist environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for indoor gardening and botanical collections.
